page.title: 09Housing in Kirkcaldy
page.content: On the north side of {Kirkcaldy} there is the {Dunnikier}housing estate which is one of the biggest private {Wimpey} estates in Britain. There are over 1200 houses and they are still building terraced, one and two bedroom houses costing from Â£22110 to Â£29680. The firm cannot build on some pieces of ground because of the old coal mine workings dug by monks.The types of houses built so far are - villas,semi- detached, bungalow and chalet.Starting after the war the Town Council built terraced and semi- detached houses then in the 1950s going west there are 3 storey blocks ,terraced houses then 6 storey blocks of flats. At the edge of the town in the Torbain area there is dense housing with service areas and parking. This also includes small blocks of sheltered housing for elderly people.
